Body: Languages are defined as subset of Kleene closure of alphabet.So the subset may be recursive set or enumerably recursive set,or non-enumerably-recursive set,the last one is not recursive,and in fact,the last two are not recursive in a strict sense.So,there are infinite languages that are not recursive.Or,there are as many non recursive infinite language as real numbers.

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: a teacher at university in china who is not a mathematician.:)
